item.title: Adding up while statement
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

In what way do you mean loop through multiple arrays? Do you want them tiered? Or all in the same iteration?

for ($i = 0; i < someNumber; $i++) { $arrayInter[i]; $arrayWord[i]; $arrayGeneral[i]; }
You’d have to be careful because the sizes of the arrays are not equal.

foreach ($arrayInter as $aa) { foreach ($arrayWord as $bb) { foreach ($arrayGeneral as $cc) { } } }
?

Read full topic

item.title: Adding up while statement
item.dc:creator: @Frantix Frantix
item.description:
@Frantix wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:8, topic:545631”] $totalCorrect = 0; for($i = 0; $i < count($arrayInter); $i++) { if($scores['quiz1a' . $arrayInter[$i]] == '1') $totalCorrect++; }[/quote]

I think I am in love thank you so much literally could not think… by any chance would you know how to make this loop through multiple arrays? E.g.

  $arrayInter = array("17", "18", "20", "21", "23", "34", "43", "44");
  $arrayWord = array("2", "3", "6", "15", "16", "28", "29", "30");
  $arrayGeneral = array("1", "4", "5", "33", "45");
Death Style:

is this a test

Yes sir and this is for the add up of the totals for each category

Read full topic

item.title: Adding up while statement
item.dc:creator: @Frantix Frantix
item.description:
@Frantix wrote:

The output for this is 10000001 how would I make it add them all up so the output would be 2? Thank you <3

$test = -1; $arrayInter = array("17", "18", "20", "21", "23", "34", "43", "44"); while($test<7){ $test++; echo $scores['quiz1a' . $arrayInter[$test]]; }

Solved:

$test = -1; $code = 0; $arrayInter = array("17", "18", "20", "21", "23", "34", "43", "44"); while($test<7){ $test++; $code = $scores['quiz1a' . $arrayInter[$test]] + $code; } echo $code;

Read full topic
